intro: Iris orientalis, commonly known as the Persian iris, is a striking perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features tall, upright stems that bear showy, violet-blue flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are arranged in a fan-like pattern at the base. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers typically bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a dramatic touch to the landscape.
